intro: Rhipidocladum racemiflorum, commonly known as the slender-leafed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its flowering period occurs during the warmer months, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Rhipidocladum racemiflorum is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions.
